titles.title: First Lunar Landing Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue coins in commemoration of the 25th Anniversary of the first lunar landing.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Consumer Credit and Insurance.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 10/22/1993--Introduced. First Lunar Landing Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to issue one-dollar coins to commemorate the 25th anniversary of the first lunar landing. Mandates that surcharges received from coin sales be paid to: (1) the Neil Armstrong Air and Space Museum (Wapakoneta, Ohio): (2) the Smithsonian Institution for the National Air and Space Museum; and (3) the Treasury for reduction of the national debt.
